name: sensor
title: Riverbed Cascade Sensor REST API
description:
Overview

The documentation pages in this section describe the RESTful APIs included with Cascade Sensor products. It is assumed that the reader has practical knowledge of RESTful APIs, so the documentation does not go into detail about what REST is and how to use it. Instead the documentation focuses on what data can be accessed and how to access it.

The following information can be accessed via the API:

  • Perform System operations
  • Information about system users

Details about REST resources can be found in the Resources section. This overview continues with how to run reports and retrieve data from them.

Authentication

All REST requests must be authenticated. The Authentication section of the Common 1.0 API describes which authentication methods are presently supported. There are also examples that show how to use each of the different authentication methods.

List users.description: Get a list of user accounts.

response.description: List of user accounts on the system.

authentication_type.description: Type of authentication for the user, such as Local or RADIUS.

authorization_type.description: Type of authorization for the user, such as Local or RADIUS.

enabled.description: Boolean flag indicating if the user account is enabled.

id.description: Numeric ID of the user that the system uses internally and in the API.

last_access.description: Time of last access to the system. Unix time (epoch).

last_authentication.description: Time of last authentication. Unix time (epoch).

last_login.description: Time of last login. Unix time (epoch).

login_timeout.description: Timeout (in seconds) during which the user cannot log in to the system because of security policies.

role.description: Role of the user. Defines permissions.

username.description: User name (short name) that identifies the user to the system, such as 'admin'.

view_packet_details.description: Boolean flag indicating if the user has access to packet data.

view_user_information.description: Boolean flag indicating if the user has access to identity information, such as Active Directory information.

authenticated.description: Flag indication if the RADIUS user was authenticated.

authorized.description: Flag indication if the RADIUS user was authorized (as Administrator, Monitor, etc).

example.details: Using 10.38.8.112:1812 - Unable to match a role.

Test RADIUS server.description: Test the connection to a RADIUS server.

success.description: Flag indication if the RADIUS server test was successful.

Re-authenticate user.description: Re-authenticate a user account. Requires basic authentication.

Get user.description: Get a user account by user ID.

authentication_type.description: Type of authentication for the user, such as Local or RADIUS.

authorization_type.description: Type of authorization for the user, such as Local or RADIUS.

enabled.description: Boolean flag indicating if the user account is enabled.

id.description: Numeric ID of the user that the system uses internally and in the API.

last_access.description: Time of last access to the system. Unix time (epoch).

last_authentication.description: Time of last authentication. Unix time (epoch).

last_login.description: Time of last login. Unix time (epoch).

login_timeout.description: Timeout (in seconds) during which the user cannot log in to the system because of security policies.

role.description: Role of the user. Defines permissions.

username.description: User name (short name) that identifies the user to the system, such as 'admin'.

view_packet_details.description: Boolean flag indicating if the user has access to packet data.

view_user_information.description: Boolean flag indicating if the user has access to identity information, such as Active Directory information.

Stop all processes.description: Stop all system processes. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/status" to poll for status. On Enterprise systems, stop system processes on all modules.

Kill all processes.description: Kill all system processes. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/status" to poll for status. On Enterprise systems, kill system processes on all modules. Warning: this operation can result in data being corrupted.

Shutdown.description: Shutdown the system. The operation is asynchronous.

Get status of all processes.description: Get status of all system processes. On Enterprise systems, get system process statuses on all modules.

module_ipaddr.description: Module IP Address. Available on Enterprise systems only.

module_name.description: Module name. Available on Enterprise systems only.

Start all processes.description: Start all system processes. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/status" to poll for status. On Enterprise systems, start system processes on all modules.

Restart all processes.description: Restart all system processes. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/status" to poll for status. On Enterprise systems, stop system processes on all modules.

Reboot.description: Reboot the system. The operation is asynchronous.

Stop all processes (one module).description: Stop all system processes on one module on Enterprise systems. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/{module}/status" to poll for status. The {module} can be either the IP Address or the module name.

Kill all processes (one module).description: Kill all system processes on one module on Enterprise systems. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/{module}/status" to poll for status. The {module} can be either the IP Address or the module name. Warning: This operation can result in data being corrupted.

Get status of all processes (one module).description: Get status of all system processes on one module on Enterprise systems. The {module} can be either the IP Address or the module name.

module_ipaddr.description: Module IP Address. Available on Enterprise systems only.

module_name.description: Module name. Available on Enterprise systems only.

Start all processes (one module).description: Start all system processes on one module on Enterprise systems. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/{module}/status" to poll for status. The {module} can be either the IP Address or the module name.

Restart all processes (one module).description: Restart all system processes on one module on Enterprise systems. The operation is asynchronous. Use "GET system/{module}/status" to poll for status. The {module} can be either the IP Address or the module name.

errors.description: The password must be changed. Access only to password change resources.
Account is either temporarily or permanently disabled.
User is not authorized to access the requested resource.
Requested method is not available for this resource.
URI parameter is not supported or malformed.
